0.title: 17 killed in rocket attack in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia: Official
0.article_body: At least 17 people were killed after buildings in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia were hit by rockets in an overnight attack by Russia, an official of the city council said on Sunday. The official added that about five private houses were destroyed and around 40 were damaged in the attack. The region's governor said, "There may be more people under the rubble."

1.title: 'Goodbye' tickets to be sold for ₹80 on Amitabh Bachchan's b'day: Report
1.article_body: To mark Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, the makers of 'Goodbye' have decided to sell the film's tickets for ₹80 on October 11. "The makers plan to promote this exciting offer and are confident that it'll result in huge footfalls," a source told Bollywood Hungama. The Vikas Bahl directorial, which released on October 7, features Amitabh with Rashmika Mandanna.

2.title: Shahbaz Ahmed should replace Gaikwad or Kishan in the 2nd ODI: Jaffer
2.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed should replace either Ruturaj Gaikwad or Ishan Kishan in Team India's lineup for the second ODI against South Africa. "Shahbaz...would be helpful in the bowling department and strengthen the batting...You cannot go ahead with...five bowling options in ODI cricket," added Jaffer. South Africa beat India by nine runs in the first ODI.

3.title: Twitter offered billions off the $44-billion deal to Elon, he refused: Musk's lawyer
3.article_body: Twitter offered "billions off the transaction price" to Elon Musk, an attorney for the world's richest person claimed. "Musk refused (the offer) because Twitter attempted to put certain self-serving conditions on the deal," Alex Spiro said. Musk has revived the $44-billion deal to take Twitter private at the original price of $54.20 per share, days before a trial in court.

4.title: Pralhad Joshi requests Gujarat CM to give space for Karnataka Bhavan
4.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi made an appeal to Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel to allow space for the construction of Karnataka Bhavan in the state. He told Gujarat CM that he would personally cooperate with the Karnataka government for the construction of the bhavan. He made the appeal during the 75th anniversary of the Kannada Sangha in Ahmedabad, Gujarat.

5.title: Age showing its effect on Nitish ji: Prashant Kishor
5.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor criticised Nitish Kumar for alleging that he is working for BJP and said, "Age showing its effect on Nitish ji." "He wants to say something but he speaks something else. If I was working on BJP's agenda, why would I speak of strengthening Congress?" Kishor added. "He's surrounded by those whom he can't trust," he said.

6.title: Protest staged after Hyd police shut petrol pumps over Eid-e-Milad
6.article_body: People staged a protest on Saturday night in Hyderabad's Chaderghat after the police shut down petrol pumps in view of Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi. The protesters demanded that the petrol pumps should be opened, with one motorist saying that the police shouldn't shut pumps without prior notice. The police arrived at the scene and dispersed the public using mild force.

7.title: Time has come for 'Bahujan Samaj' to become 'ruler society': Mayawati
7.article_body: On the death anniversary of party founder Kanshiram, BSP Chief Mayawati said that the time has come for the "Bahujan Samaj" to become the "Hukmran Samaj" (ruler society). "Bahujan Samaj has got tired of demanding its constitutional and legal rights," tweeted Mayawati. "This is today's message and this work has to be done with determination," she added.

8.title: BJP won't be able to erase Tipu’s legacy: Owaisi on renaming of Tipu Express
8.article_body: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday criticised the BJP government after the Railway Board changed name of the train connecting Bengaluru and Mysuru from Tipu Express to Wodeyar Express. "Tipu irks BJP because he waged three wars against its British masters…BJP will never be able to erase Tipu’s legacy," Owaisi added. "Another train could've been named after Wodeyars," Owaisi stated.

9.title: KTR represents a failed government that cheated Telangana: BJP
9.article_body: BJP leader Ponguleti Sudhakar Reddy criticised Telangana minister KTR for his remarks against RSS, claiming that the minister represents a failed government that cheated the citizens. "I strongly condemn the irrelevant remarks made by KTR. It is baseless. The BJP demands that he withdraws it," said Reddy. KTR had previously asked RSS chief to refrain from loose talk.

10.title: Video shows electric poles installed in middle of a Pak road, Twitter users react
10.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video wherein electricity poles were installed in the middle of a road in Pakistan. The video, shot by the commuter from inside a vehicle, showed the poles not aligned in a single line, making them dangerous for travellers. A Twitter user commented, "A great example of incompetence," while some others tagged the state government.

11.title: Manoj Bajpayee to star in a courtroom drama, says it'll 'intrigue' audience
11.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee will be part of an untitled courtroom drama. Talking about the project, Bajpayee said he was "fascinated" by the script and added that it will "intrigue the audience". Stating that he "immediately agreed to be a part" of the film, the actor said it's a project that "people will remember for a really long time".

12.title: I had butterflies: Suryakumar on 1st practice session in Australia
12.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav, in a video released by BCCI, said he had butterflies during his first practice session in Australia ahead of the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I was looking forward to coming here and attending the first practice session...Just wanted to feel how the pace of the wicket is, how the bounce is," Suryakumar said in the video.

13.title: Rajasthan Congress MLA & former minister Bhanwar Lal Sharma passes away at 77
13.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA and former minister Bhanwar Lal Sharma passed away at the age of 77 in Jaipur on Sunday. State CM Ashok Gehlot expressed his condolences, saying that Sharma was "unwell for a long time" and that he was in touch with Sharma's family and met them at hospital last night. Sharma was a seven-term MLA from Sardarshahar (Churu).

14.title: Pune couple booked for forging documents to get ₹50 lakh insurance claim
14.article_body: A couple in Pune has been booked for trying to cheat an insurance company. The accused man had invested in a life insurance policy for ₹25 lakh and an accident insurance term plan of ₹25 lakh in January and made his wife the nominee. In March, his wife presented fake documents, death certificate to the insurance company to extract money.

15.title: Such 'drama' will carry on till 2024 polls: Tejashwi on chargesheet against Lalu
15.article_body: After CBI filed a chargesheet against his father and RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in the land-for-job scam, Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said constitutional institutions are being constantly "misused" and that such "drama" will carry on till the 2024 polls. "In this case, only CBI is there...ED will also come, it will investigate and file a chargesheet," Tejashwi added.

16.title: Anna Sorokin, who posed as fake heiress with $67 mn fortune, released from US jail
16.article_body: Anna Sorokin, convicted of scamming $275,000 from banks, hotels and wealthy elites by pretending to be a German heiress, has been released from an immigration detention centre in New York. Sorokin will remain in 24-hour home confinement and is barred from using social media. Sorokin posed as Anna Delvey and lied about having a $67 million fortune to scam others.

17.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyd in view of Eid-e-Milad processions
17.article_body: In view of Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions to be taken out on Sunday, the Hyderabad Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory. The traffic diversions/restrictions will be in place from 8 am to 6 pm today. All flyovers, except the Begumpet flyover, Lunger House flyover, Dabeerpura flyover, Lalapet flyover and PVNR Expressway, will be closed during this period.

18.title: Father chains UP woman in room for 36 yrs; family threw water from window to bathe her
18.article_body: A 53-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad has been freed 36 years after she was chained inside a room by her father. Her family slipped meals from beneath the door and threw water at her from the window for her to bathe. An NGO that helped in her rescue said the woman was found in very poor condition.

19.title: Jackky and I don't talk about work, it's a conscious choice: Rakul
19.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said she doesn't discuss work with her boyfriend Jackky Bhagnani. "We don't really talk about work and it is a conscious choice as it can get quite complicated," she said, adding that she seeks his opinion whenever she feels stuck. She added that the actor-producer "loved" the trailer of her upcoming film 'Doctor G'.

20.title: Everybody misses him: Shardul on Dhoni ahead of 2nd SA ODI in Ranchi
20.article_body: India bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, on being asked about MS Dhoni in the pre-match press conference ahead of their second ODI against South Africa in Ranchi, said, "Everybody misses Dhoni." Shardul added, "Dhoni played more than 300 ODIs...So this much-experienced player, it is rare that you come across such an experienced player. We miss him definitely."

21.title: N Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles, seventh launch since Sept 25
21.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles towards its eastern waters on Sunday, according to authorities in South Korea and Japan. This is the seventh missile launch by North Korea since September 25. A day earlier, North Korea said that missile launches are a "planned self-defence measure to protect the country's security and regional peace from direct US military threats".

22.title: Toyota says nearly 3 lakh pieces of customer info possibly leaked
22.article_body: Toyota Motor Corporation has said that about 2,96,000 pieces of customer information such as email addresses and numbers may have been leaked from its T-Connect, a telematics service that connects vehicles via a network. It further said that the affected customers are individuals who have been signed up on the service's website since July 2017.

23.title: India reports 2,756 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 28,593
23.article_body: India reported 2,756 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 3,393 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 28,593. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,28,799, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.15%.

24.title: Can't be more grateful: Abdu on B'wood debut with 'Kisi Ka Bhai...'
24.article_body: Tajikistan's social media star Abdu Rozik said he "cannot be more grateful" to Salman Khan for giving him the opportunity to star in 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. "I hope I can repay him one day for this opportunity," Abdu said, adding he's "nervous and excited" about his Bollywood debut. Abdu also dedicated his first Hindi single to Salman.

25.title: Yellow alert issued for parts of Maharashtra for next 3 to 4 days: IMD
25.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a yellow alert for parts of central Maharashtra, Marathwada and Konkan for the next three to four days. "Mostly for the entire Maharashtra, there are expectations of thundershowers associated with isolated heavy rainfall," an IMD official said. Several parts of Mumbai faced waterlogging due to incessant rains on Saturday.

26.title: PM Modi to hold 40 rallies in 144 LS seats lost in 2019 polls: Reports
26.article_body: The BJP is planning to conduct 40 rallies across the 144 Lok Sabha seats it lost in the 2019 polls. According to reports, PM Narendra Modi will hold 40 big rallies in 40 clusters. BJP National President JP Nadda, Union Home Minister Amit Shah and other leaders are likely to hold public meetings in the remaining 104 seats.

27.title: Panic of the BJP govt: Rahul Gandhi after attack on Cong MLA in Gujarat
27.article_body: Following the attack on Congress MLA and tribal leader Anant Patel in Gujarat on Saturday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "This is the panic of the BJP government." Rahul further wrote, "Attack on our MLA...by the BJP is condemnable." Patel has alleged that he was thrashed by goons led by the Navsari district panchayat president.

28.title: Rafael Nadal becomes father for the first time, blessed with a baby boy
28.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal and his wife Xisca Perelló have been blessed with their first child, a baby boy. The couple, who have been together since 2005 and tied the knot in 2019, have reportedly named their son 'Rafael'. Xisca delivered the baby in a private clinic in Mallorca.

29.title: I bought Pixel just to use 5G and it's not showing 5G network option: Paytm CEO
29.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted that he bought the Google Pixel 6a only to use 5G but it wasn't showing the 5G network option in Delhi even after upgrades. He shared a screenshot saying the device manufacturer is yet to release 5G software upgrade. Tagging Google, he asked, "Do you think India should get 5G handset software upgrade soon?"

30.title: Supporting Ukraine to cost SpaceX $100 million by 2022 end: Musk
30.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to respond to a Financial Times article discussing Ukrainian soldiers experiencing Starlink outages, and said, "This operation has cost SpaceX $80 million and will exceed $100 million by end of [the] year." "This article falsely claims that Starlink terminals and service were paid for when only a small percentage have been," he added.

31.title: DNA test to identify completely charred bodies in Nashik bus accident
31.article_body: The Maharashtra Police will conduct DNA and some other forensic tests to ascertain the identity of the deceased in Maharashtra's Nashik bus accident, which claimed 12 lives so far. The police and local administration were able to identify seven of the total 12 deceased by Saturday evening. Some of the survivors also reportedly assisted police in identifying the victims.

32.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra not conceived as 'chunav jitao yatra': Cong's Jairam
32.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra was seen as a yatra to revive, resuscitate and reinvigorate Congress party organisation around a national narrative other than political power. "This was never conceived as a 'chunav jitao yatra' when it was conceived in Udaipur. It was seen as a yatra to rejuvenate Congress," The Print quoted him as saying.

33.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging in several areas in Delhi; pics surface
33.article_body: Several areas in Delhi faced waterlogging and traffic jams following heavy rainfall. The traffic police also issued an advisory for six stretches of roads, like Aurobindo Marg and Dhaula Kuan flyover, which were affected by waterlogging or potholes and asked commuters to avoid them. According to IMD, rainfall is likely to persist on Sunday in the national capital.

34.title: 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' is a celebratory film: Karan Johar
34.article_body: Director Karan Johar said his film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' is a "celebratory film", which has "all the elements" that he loves watching and having as a part of his films. He added he's "very privileged" to have worked with Dharmendra, Jaya Bachchan and Shabana Azmi in the film, which he also described as a "family love story".

35.title: Middle-order will remain an issue for Pak: Hafeez on Pak's T20I vs NZ
35.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan's decision to promote Shadab Khan and Muhammad Nawaz in their recent T20I against New Zealand, ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez tweeted, "It'll put more...[doubt] in the minds of [the] middle-order batters." "If [there's] no confidence [in] them, then why're they with the team? Middle order will remain an issue," added Hafeez. Pakistan beat New Zealand by six wickets.

36.title: Cong MLA attacked in Gujarat, told 'won't let an an Adivasi walk here'
36.article_body: Congress MLA Anant Patel was attacked by goons at Khergam town in the Navsari district of Gujarat on Saturday. Patel has alleged that the attack was carried out by the Navsari district panchayat president Bhikhubhai Ahir. He further said that the goons made casteist slurs and said, "You're becoming a leader being an Adivasi. Won't let an Adivasi walk here."

37.title: Ayushmann's 'Doctor G' gets 'A' certification from CBFC: Report
37.article_body: Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has reportedly cleared Ayushmann Khurrana and Rakul Preet Singh's 'Doctor G' with an 'A' certificate. Reportedly, CBFC members felt some of the terms and jokes in the film "were not family friendly" and the makers weren't in favour of cutting scenes and dialogues. Hence, the makers decided to go for the adult rating.

38.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory in view of religious processions
38.article_body: The Delhi Police issued traffic advisory regarding traffic arrangements in view of 'Shobha Yatra' of Maharishi Valmiki and Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions to be taken out today. As per the advisory, there will be restrictions on movement of traffic on Netaji Subhash Marg, Chawri Bazar Road, Ajmeri Gate Road, Desh Bandhu Gupta Road, Chitra Gupta Road, Panchkuian Marg and Mandir Marg.

39.title: Before end of 2024, UP roads will be equivalent to US: Gadkari
39.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday announced road projects worth ₹8,000 crore for Uttar Pradesh. He said that he's promised state CM Yogi Adityanath that before the end of 2024, the state's road infrastructure will be "equivalent to that of...US". He also added that road projects worth ₹5 lakh crore will be done in the state before end of 2024.

40.title: India releases statement after Pak, Germany's remarks on J&K, mentions 26/11 attacks
40.article_body: India has responded after German Foreign Minister called for UN's engagement in J&K during a joint presser with Pakistan's Bilawal Bhutto. Highlighting cross-border terrorism in J&K and other states, India said UNSC is still pursuing Pakistan-based terrorists involved in 26/11 attacks. "When states do not recognise such dangers...[they] do grave injustice to the victims of terrorism," India noted.

41.title: David Miller's young fan passes away ahead of 2nd ODI against India, he shares pics
41.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller's young fan and close friend's daughter Ane passed away ahead of second India-South Africa ODI. Miller shared a video comprising pictures of Ane. "RIP you little rockstar...Love you always!" Miller wrote. "You taught me so much about cherishing every single moment in life! I feel humbled to have walked a journey with you," he added.

42.title: Wherever you enter in UP, you will get four-lane connectivity: CM Yogi
42.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said, "Wherever you enter in UP, you'll get four-lane connectivity." While addressing an event, CM Yogi said UP is moving ahead in the field of infrastructure under the inspiration of PM Narendra Modi. "Today UP is the front-runner in implementing FDR technology. Our rural roads are being built with this technology," CM Yogi stated.

43.title: BJP wants to create animosity: Shivakumar on renaming of Tipu Express
43.article_body: Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee President DK Shivakumar criticised the BJP for renaming Tipu Express and said that the party wants everyone to fight and create animosity within the communities. "We are not saying that you should not keep Wodeyar's name. Start another 4-5 trains and keep everyone's name. But the removal of Tipu's name is not right," said Shivakumar.

44.title: Schools teaching 'if you're rich, you're evil': Musk on daughter who cut ties with him
44.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk spoke to Financial Times about his relationship with his teenage daughter who recently came out as transgender and cut ties with him. Musk blamed his daughter's decision on the supposed takeover of elite schools and universities by neo-Marxists and said, "It's full-on communism...and a general sentiment that if you're rich, you're evil."

45.title: Musk sought 30% discount before offering to buy Twitter again for $44 bn: Report
45.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk reportedly asked for a 30% discount for Twitter before reviving his original bid of $44 billion. As per a report, Musk's team sought a 30% price reduction, which would have valued Twitter at around $31 billion. However, Twitter rejected the offer and while the discussion moved to a 10% discount, that too was rejected.

46.title: BJP leader booked for allegedly cheating builder of ₹15 crore in Pune
46.article_body: The Pune Police have lodged a cheating case against BJP leader and former corporator Ramakrishna Govindaswamy Pillay in Pimpri for allegedly cheating a builder of ₹15 crore. The case is related to land fraud that took place between February 2019 and May 2022. No arrests have been made so far.

47.title: We're taking notes: 'Adipurush' director on criticism against the film
47.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut said that he and his team are "taking notes" of all the criticism the film's teaser has received. "For us, our audience is supreme. So, all the sages, our elders, whoever is telling us things, we are taking note of it," Raut said. The director guaranteed that the Prabhas starrer won't "disappoint anyone".

48.title: 665 rare, exotic animals seized in an import consignment in Mumbai
48.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) in Mumbai recovered 665 animals of exotic species including pythons, lizards, turtles and iguanas in an import consignment, officials said. The recovery was one of the biggest seizures of rare and exotic wildlife species in Mumbai in recent years, the officials added. The animals were found concealed in cartons containing fish.

49.title: Newly-bought car crashes into a row of parked bikes, tilts on 2 wheels, video viral
49.article_body: A video of a newly-bought car, decorated with a garland, crashing into a row of parked bikes and then tilting on its two wheels has gone viral. The video was shared by Twitter user Sqn Ldr Vinod Kumar (Retd), captioned, "What a grand arrival home?" While the location wasn't revealed, the incident took place inside an apartment complex last Thursday.

50.title: Growing up on sets made me the kind of artiste I’m today: Ajay Devgn
50.article_body: Ajay Devgn said his experiences on film sets have "contributed to the kind of artiste" he's transformed into today. The actor-filmmaker, who made his acting debut with 'Phool Aur Kaante' (1991), will be next seen in 'Thank God', 'Drishyam 2' and 'Maidaan'. His next directorial venture is 'Bholaa', which is a Hindi remake of the Tamil film 'Kaithi'.

51.title: Don't put pressure on him all the time: Karim on Dhawan's 4(16) in 1st SA ODI
51.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim has said there's no need to put pressure on Shikhar Dhawan over his performance "all the time". "There will be...matches where he won't score runs. [But] I think the selectors have decided that Rohit and Dhawan will be the openers in the [2023] WC," added Karim. Dhawan scored 4(16) in the first ODI against South Africa.

52.title: Meta cancels internship offers in UK amid cost-cutting, Apple Co-founder reacts
52.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak took to Twitter to comment on a report about Meta withdrawing internship offers for London-based recruits, who were to start from January 2023, amid cost-cutting measures. Wozniak wrote, "When COVID prevented our house workers from coming, Janet and I made the sacrifice to continue paying their full salaries because it was the right thing to do."

53.title: Cong chief poll candidates people of stature, can’t be remote controlled: Rahul
53.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday described party Presidential poll candidates Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor as people of stature and understanding. "Both the people who are standing have a position and perspective…I don’t think either of them is going to be a remote control (party chief) and frankly, this tone is insulting to both of them," Gandhi added.

54.title: CBI questions Tejashwi's personal secretary in land-for-jobs scam in railways
54.article_body: The CBI on Saturday questioned the private secretary of Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in connection with the land-for-jobs scam in the railways. This comes after CBI filed a chargesheet against RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, his wife Rabri Devi and their daughter Misa Bharti in the case. A total of 16 people have been named in the chargesheet.

55.title: Newborn girl found amid garbage dump in Delhi, taken to hospital
55.article_body: A police station in Delhi on Saturday received a call in which the caller informed the police that he'd found a newborn girl lying amid a garbage dump and brought the baby home as it was raining, DCP (South West) said. Following this, the baby was handed over to police who took her to a hospital, DCP (South West) added.

56.title: Finance Minister buys vegetables from street vendor in Chennai; shares pics
56.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared pictures and a video of her buying vegetables from a street vendor in Chennai. "During her day-long visit to Chennai, Smt Nirmala Sitharaman made a halt at Mylapore market where she interacted with the vendors & local residents and also purchased vegetables," her office tweeted. The video showed locals coming to greet her.

57.title: Family is my priority, it's okay if I've to sacrifice good films: Kareena
57.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan said her family is her priority and she feels it's okay to sacrifice a few good films or scripts for them "because it's worth it". She revealed that between husband Saif Ali Khan and her, one parent is always looking after their kids - Taimur Ali Khan and Jeh Ali Khan. "We keep taking turns," Kareena added.

58.title: Hyderabad police seize ₹79 lakh hawala money, arrest 4 people
58.article_body: Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta police arrested four people and seized ₹79 lakh hawala money on Saturday. The arrests were made after police spotted people exchanging bags under suspicious circumstances and on checking the bags, found the money. During interrogation, it was revealed that two of the accused planned to do hawala activities as their earnings aren't sufficient to meet family expenses.

59.title: 100 new electric buses to join Bengaluru's public transport
59.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) received 100 new electric buses from the electric vehicle company Switch Mobility. For each electric bus, the central government has funded ₹55 lakh and the Karnataka government funded ₹33.33 lakh. The e-buses are non-AC and 12-metre-long with a seating capacity of 40 people and have a wheel-chair mechanism which is electrically operated.

60.title: Kanye returns to Twitter after Instagram restricts account, posts pic with Zuckerberg
60.article_body: Rapper Kanye West posted on Twitter for the first time in nearly two years after his Instagram account was restricted for violating its policies. Posting a picture of himself with Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, he tweeted, "Look at this Mark...How you gone kick me off instagram." Kanye had shared a now-deleted post on Instagram that was criticised for being anti-Semitic.

61.title: Mumbai's Shahad Bridge to be widened by MMRDA
61.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) has developed a plan to widen the Shahad Bridge that falls on the Kalyan-Murbad-Ahmednagar route. This bridge, which is currently 10 metres wide, will be widened by 30 metres. Around two lakh vehicles reportedly use the bridge daily, many of these being trucks carrying vegetables from the rural parts of Murbad, Ahmednagar.

62.title: Cong shares videos of Bharat Jodo Yatra as march completes 1 month
62.article_body: Congress took to Twitter on Saturday to share videos and photographs from Bharat Jodo Yatra as the march completed one month. It said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi made the "first call to unite India" by starting the yatra on September 7. The party also shared a picture where Rahul Gandhi is seen delivering a speech amid heavy rain in Karnataka.

63.title: US, Japan hold joint drill in light of North Korean missile launches
63.article_body: Japan and the US are conducting a joint military drill involving US aircraft carrier Ronald Reagan in Japan's vicinity in light of North Korea's repeated missile launches, Tokyo said on Saturday. North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Thursday that landed outside Japan's exclusive economic zone. Prior to that, Pyongyang fired an intermediate-range missile over Japan on Tuesday.

64.title: Reality is, I won't be on the grid in 2023 F1 season: Ricciardo
64.article_body: McLaren driver Daniel Ricciardo has admitted that he will not be driving in F1 for the 2023 season and is focusing on securing an opportunity for the 2024 season. "I think that there could be some better opportunities then...and now where the sights are set," said Ricciardo. He is reportedly in contention to be the Mercedes reserve driver for 2023.

65.title: I am going to call it a draw: Ponting on Hardik vs Maxwell debate
65.article_body: Ex-Australian skipper Ricky Ponting has commented on the debate on which player between Hardik Pandya and Glenn Maxwell will have more impact in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I think Maxwell will end up scoring more runs than Hardik. And I think Hardik will take more wickets than Maxwell. So, I'm going to call that one a draw," Ponting said.

66.title: Sad for tournament & fans that Medvedev retired mid-match: Djokovic
66.article_body: Tennis star Novak Djokovic said he is "sad" for the Astana Open tournament and the fans after Daniil Medvedev retired midway through their semifinal clash. "He wouldn't retire a match if he didn't feel that he (could) continue...I would probably say he was a better player (today)," said Djokovic. The match was poised at 4-6, 7-6(6) when the Russian retired.

67.title: Excited about WC; I know Australian conditions, grounds: Chahal
67.article_body: Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said that he is excited about the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I have been here (Australia) before...so I know the conditions and the grounds," Chahal said. He added, "When there's [some] bounce in the wicket, you need not bowl fast...[and] focus on bowling the top spinner. The batters might not always connect cross-batted shots here."

68.title: Ronaldo, Messi are greatest ever players but time catches up with all: Rooney
68.article_body: Ex-footballer Wayne Rooney said that Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi are two of the greatest players to ever play football but time catches up with everybody. "He's (Ronaldo) obviously not the player he was when he was 22 or 23, for instance. It's a tough one for him," Rooney said. Ronaldo and Rooney played together for Manchester United from 2004-09.

69.title: Rahul means Bharat, Bharat means Rahul: UP Congress chief Khabri
69.article_body: Reacting to Congress MP Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Yatra, newly-appointed President of Uttar Pradesh Congress Brijlal Khabri said, "Rahul means Bharat, and Bharat means Rahul." Responding to queries on why the yatra is scheduled to pass through just one district in Uttar Pradesh, Khabri said, "Bharat is not a district nor it is a state. It's a union of states."

70.title: 8 killed in clashes between pro-govt forces and Houthis in Yemen
70.article_body: At least eight people were killed in clashes between Yemen's pro-government forces and the Houthi rebels in the country's disputed Yafa area. Four troops were killed from both sides and five others were injured. The two sides have been fighting since 2015 after the Iran-backed Houthi rebels captured capital Sanaa, leading to a response from a Saudi Arabia-led coalition.

71.title: Ready to give the best for my team: Shafali after India's win vs Bangladesh
71.article_body: Following India's 59-run win against Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup, India opener Shafali Verma, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', said, "I'm always ready to give my best for the team with the bat and ball." She added, "It was a bit difficult pitch for batting as the ball kept low." Shafali scored a 44-ball 55 and posted 2/10.

72.title: Missing T20 WC berth is big setback but lot of cricket still left: Shardul
72.article_body: Indian seamer Shardul Thakur said that missing out on a berth in the squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup is a "big setback" for him. "Every player dreams to play in the WC...It's okay [that] I'm not selected," Thakur said. He added, "But there's still a lot of cricket left and also there's the ODI WC next year."

73.title: Goa to host 37th National Games in October 2023: IOA
73.article_body: Goa will host the 37th National Games in October next year, the Indian Olympic Association said on Saturday. "The dates of the 37th National Games will be decided keeping in view the dates of 19th Asian Games, which will be held from September 23 to October 8, 2023, in Hangzhou, China," added IOA.

74.title: I've been focussing on my batting since some time now: Shardul
74.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second ODI, India all-rounder Shardul Thakur said he has been focussing on his batting since a while. "Batting at seven, eight or nine if these batters can add runs to the total, it is great," he added. Shardul, who batted at number seven in first ODI, scored 33 runs off 31 balls.

75.title: Won't call Dhawan-led Indian ODI side second string: SA spinner Maharaj
75.article_body: South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj said he wouldn't call Shikhar Dhawan-led India a "second-string" side after his side defeated the hosts by nine runs in first ODI in Lucknow on Thursday. "India have so much talent that they can field four-five proper international sides...There are world class performers out there," he added. Second ODI will be played on Sunday.

76.title: Kejriwal chants 'Jai Shri Ram' at rally amid poster row in Gujarat
76.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister and AAP Convener Arvind Kejriwal chanted "Jai Shri Ram" and "Jai Shri Krishna" at the party's rally in Gujarat after posters targeting him emerged in the state on Saturday. Some posters called him "anti-Hindu". Kejriwal claimed the posters have used words which are insulting gods along with him. He further said that he's a very religious person.

77.title: I'll be forced to leave Punjab if no arrests are made: Shehnaaz's father on death threats
77.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill's father Santokh Singh, who has alleged that he received death threats from an unknown person via phone call, said he'll be forced to leave Punjab and settle elsewhere if no arrests are made. "I think they want to target me because I am Hindu leader," he stated. The caller allegedly told that he'd kill him before Diwali.

78.title: Shocked: Maiden Pharma on its cough syrups being blamed for 66 kids' deaths in Gambia
78.article_body: After WHO issued an alert against four cough and cold syrups manufactured by India's Maiden Pharmaceuticals, which allegedly called the death of 66 children in Gambia, the company issued a statement expressing 'shock and sadness' over the deaths. It said they're not selling any cough syrups in the domestic market, adding, "We have valid drug approvals for exports."

79.title: Indian mission in UK investigating illegal visa agents
79.article_body: The Indian High Commission in London said it is probing reports that illegal agents are charging fees to process visas of travellers going to India from the UK. The statement comes amid reports there is a shortage of visas for British tourists. "It has come to our notice that unauthorised agents...are illegally charging fees," the High Commission said.

80.title: NASA releases new pic of Jupiter's ice-covered moon Europa captured by Juno
80.article_body: NASA has shared a new picture of Jupiter's Europa moon, which is the smallest of the gas giant's four Galilean moons and also the sixth largest moon in our solar system. The picture was taken by NASA's Juno spacecraft on September 29, 2022. It revealed the "complex, ice-covered surface" of Europa as captured by Juno during its flyby.

81.title: Pierre Gasly joins Alpine F1 for 2023, Alpha Tauri signs Nyck de Vries
81.article_body: Driver Pierre Gasly will replace two-time world champion Fernando Alonso at Alpine F1 next season. Meanwhile, Dutchman Nyck de Vries, who made his F1 debut at last month's Italian Grand Prix, will replace Gasly at Alpha Tauri. "They have a complete package and similar ambitions to mine," said Gasly, who will partner fellow Frenchman Esteban Ocon in the French team.

82.title: It's a big setback: Shardul Thakur on not being selected in India's T20 World Cup squad
82.article_body: Bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, talking about not being selected in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, said, "Of course, it's a big setback. Every player dreams to play in World Cup...not just play but win it as well." He added, "It's okay...I'm not selected this time...but there's still lot of cricket left and also there's ODI World Cup next year."

83.title: 3 J&K men experimenting with de-addiction meds inject drugs, held
83.article_body: The Srinagar Police on Saturday sent three men to a de-addiction centre after a video purportedly showing them injecting drugs into each other in Jammu and Kashmir's Noorbagh village surfaced online. An investigation has revealed that the trio was experimenting with medicines provided by a de-addiction centre, by injecting them into their veins instead of orally taking them, police said.

84.title: AR Murugadoss and Suriya to team up for 'Ghajini 2': Reports
84.article_body: Director AR Murugadoss and actor Suriya are reportedly reuniting for the second instalment of 'Ghajini'. It will mark third collaboration between Murugadoss and Suriya. The Tamil film, which was released in 2005, also featured Asin, Nayanthara and Pradeep Singh Rawat. The film was remade in Hindi starring Aamir Khan in the lead role.

85.title: Cristiano Ronaldo often fighting with Man Utd manager ten Hag: Report
85.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo is reportedly often fighting with manager Erik ten Hag behind the scenes due to differences in opinion. Ronaldo is said to have repeatedly complained about the nature and quality of training sessions and believes the club needs to play a different system. The player also reportedly considers the manager to be stubborn with his methods.

86.title: TRS cannot become national party by changing name: Cong's Kharge
86.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) cannot become a national party by changing its name. He said that several regional parties changed their names in the past to go national, but nothing happened. "ADMK became AIADMK, TMC became All India TMC. Did they become national parties," Kharge questioned.

87.title: Woman to donate her uterus to daughter in Australia so she can get pregnant again
87.article_body: An Australian woman is set to receive her mother's uterus as part of a clinical trial at the Royal Hospital for Women in Sydney. Kirsty Bryant, 29, had to undergo a hysterectomy after suffering from post-partum haemorrhage in 2021. If the transplant surgery is successful, she'll potentially give birth to a baby from the same womb she was born from.

88.title: Nike suspends relationship with Hockey Canada amid sex assault allegations
88.article_body: Nike has suspended its relationship with Hockey Canada as the organisation faces "increased scrutiny" over its handling of sexual assault allegations, the world's largest sportswear maker said on Friday. In May, news of an alleged group sexual assault involving members of Canada's 2018 world junior team and subsequent out-of-court settlement had emerged.

89.title: India's 18-year-old Shafali breaks world record, becomes youngest to score 1,000 T20I runs
89.article_body: India's 18-year-old opener Shafali Verma has broken the world record for being the fastest batter to reach 1,000 runs in T20I cricket. She achieved the feat during India's Women's Asia Cup 2022 match on Saturday. Shafali got to 1,000 runs aged 18 years and 253 days. This record was earlier held by Jemimah Rodrigues aged 21 years and 32 days.

90.title: Sitharaman says KCR changed party's name 'on Tantrik's advice'
90.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday alleged that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao renamed his party from Telangana Rashtra Samiti (TRS) to Bharat Rashtra Samiti (BRS) on a "Tantrik's advice". Following the advice of "Tantriks and numerologists", Rao "did not...induct women for many years in his cabinet" and "stopped going to the Secretariat", Sitharaman added, as per ANI.

91.title: President Murmu, Rajnath Singh attend IAF's 90th anniversary show
91.article_body: President Murmu and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh attended the Indian Air Force's 90th-anniversary celebrations in Chandigarh on Saturday. "The nation is proud of IAF for bravely guarding our skies and rendering help during calamities," the President tweeted. Singh described the IAF's show as "breathtaking". Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar and Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher also attended the event.

92.title: Insurgency and drug trafficking are 2 sides of a coin: Amit Shah
92.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said seizing narcotics alone was not enough but the entire channel of drug movement from trafficker to consumer must be destroyed. He said, "Insurgency along with arms trade and drug trafficking are two sides of a coin." Shah made the comments while speaking at the 'Drug Trafficking and National Security' meeting in Guwahati on Saturday.

93.title: Expected a very positive response to 'Adipurush' teaser: Director Om
93.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut said he expected a very positive response to the film's teaser. "It's kind of mixed. There are a lot of people who're saying good things about it. There are some people who're not, and there are some differences in their minds," he added. Om further said people won't be disappointed after watching the film in January.

94.title: Brijlal Khabri assumes charge as Congress chief of Uttar Pradesh
94.article_body: Former BSP MP Brijlal Khabri took charge as the new President of Uttar Pradesh Congress Committee at party's state headquarters on Saturday. "Khabri paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi and Babasaheb Ambedkar, and vowed to fight against the corrupt government," the party's state wing tweeted. The 61-year-old leader, who belongs to the Dalit community, had joined the Congress in 2016.

95.title: Delhi records 137 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
95.article_body: Delhi reported 137 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.73% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Saturday. One death due to the infection was also recorded in the national capital, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. The city's active case count stood at 397, the bulletin said.

96.title: Rahul Gandhi to vote from 'yatra' campsite for Congress chief poll
96.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and 40 party delegates, who are involved in the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', will be voting for the Congress' presidential election from a campsite in Karnataka's Ballari district. The voters will take a break from the 'Yatra' and cast their ballots. The voting will be held on October 17 and results will be declared on October 19.

97.title: Prashant Kishor wanted me to merge JD(U) & Congress: Nitish Kumar
97.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar claimed that poll strategist Prashant Kishor had once asked him to merge JD(U) with the Congress. "He came to meet me recently...I did not invite him...Whatever he says, doesn't make any sense," said Kumar. Kishor on Tuesday claimed that Kumar called him to his residence recently and asked him to lead the JD(U).

98.title: If you take religion, I'm also not a Hindu: SS Rajamouli
98.article_body: Highlighting the difference between the Hindu religion and Hindu dharma, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said, "Before Hinduism the religion, there existed Hinduism the dharma." While dharma is a way of life, religion is a philosophy, he added. "If you take the religion, I'm also not a Hindu, but if you take the dharma, I'm very much a Hindu," Rajamouli said.

99.title: I'm sent by God to finish off Kansa's descendants: Kejriwal on Gujarat posters
99.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal reacted to the posters calling him "anti-Hindu" that were pasted across Gujarat and said that God has sent him with a special task to finish off demon Kansa's descendants and rid the public of corruption and hooligans. "We'll work together to fulfil God's desire. God is with me. People are with me," Kejriwal said.

100.title: CBI examines ex-Governor Satya Pal Malik in J&K corruption cases
100.article_body: Former Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has been questioned by the CBI in connection with two graft cases registered in Jammu and Kashmir in April based on allegations levelled by him. Malik had claimed that he was offered a ₹300 crore-bribe for clearing two files during his tenure as J&K's Governor between August 23, 2018 and October 30, 2019.

101.title: BJP aims to win 12 of 14 Lok Sabha seats in Assam for 2024 polls: CM
101.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said the BJP has set a target of winning 12 out of 14 seats in Assam in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "We will not stop till...Lok Sabha polls. We want to see Narendra Modi as Prime Minister for the third time," Sarma said, adding BJP won nine seats in Assam last time.

102.title: 'Palace on Wheels' resumes service after 2-yr COVID-19-induced gap
102.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot flagged off the 'Palace on Wheels' luxury train on Saturday, after a coronavirus-forced two-year break. "Its (the train's) resumption indicates that (the) tourism sector...is going to emerge stronger," Gehlot said at the Gandhinagar Railway Station. He said additional amenities have been added to the train by the Railways and the Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation.

103.title: Daycare worker chases crying kid in Halloween mask in US, fired as video goes viral
103.article_body: A woman working at a daycare centre in the US was fired after a video of her scaring children while wearing a 'Scream' Halloween mask went viral online. A video showed her chasing a crying child and another showed her getting close to a boy and asking him, "Have you been bad, do you want me to take you outside!"

104.title: 7 Djiboutian soldiers killed by 'terrorists', prez adviser says
104.article_body: Seven soldiers were killed in clashes between the army and "a terrorist group" on Thursday night in northern Djibouti, a presidential adviser told Reuters on Saturday. The presidential aide blamed the Front for the Restoration of Unity and Democracy (FRUD) for the attack. FRUD has, however, denied responsibility for the attack and pinned the blame on a splinter group instead.

105.title: EC freezes Shiv Sena's election symbol amid fight between Uddhav, Shinde camps
105.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) on Saturday said neither former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's camp nor the Eknath Shinde-led faction will be permitted to use Shiv Sena's 'bow and arrow' symbol in the Andheri East bypoll. As per EC's order, both groups shall be allotted different symbols which they may choose from the list of free symbols notified by the EC.

106.title: Heroin worth ₹350 cr seized from Pakistani boat off Gujarat coast
106.article_body: In a joint operation, the Indian Coast Guard and Gujarat ATS seized nearly 50 kg heroin, worth ₹350 crores, from a Pakistani boat on the intervening night of October 7 and 8, an ATS official said. Six crew members were also apprehended. The boat was spotted moving suspiciously in Indian waters, 40 nautical miles from Jakhau port, the official added.

107.title: Svante Pääbo's friends toss him into pond to celebrate his Nobel Prize win
107.article_body: Swedish scientist Svante Pääbo's friends tossed him into water at Germany's Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology to celebrate his Nobel Prize in Medicine win. "Normally throwing a colleague into...pond happens when somebody receives a PhD, and [Svante's colleagues] wanted to do it for his Nobel Prize as well," the Twitter account of The Nobel Prize wrote sharing a video.

108.title: 40,000 kg drugs destroyed in Northeast in presence of Amit Shah
108.article_body: About 40,000 kg of drugs, seized by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) and other agencies, were destroyed in the Northeastern states in the virtual presence of Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday. While 11,000 kg of drugs seized by the NCB were destroyed in Guwahati, another 8,000 kg seized by the government agencies in Assam were also set ablaze.

109.title: BJP supporters tear AAP banners ahead of Kejriwal rally in Gujarat
109.article_body: BJP supporters tore apart banners of AAP in Vadodara ahead of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's rally in poll-bound Gujarat on Saturday. They also painted the words "anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back" on a road. BJP supporters were protesting against AAP MLA Rajendra Pal Gautam, who recently attended a religious conversion event where people denounced Hindu deities.

110.title: Man gets challans for violations by scooter with tampered plate, says 'E looks like F'
110.article_body: A Mumbai car owner said he has been issued multiple challans for a two-wheeler he doesn't own. He alleged that due to fuzzy appearance of registration plate, 'EJ' often gets mistaken for 'FJ' and challans are generated on his four-wheeler. After Traffic Police advised him to file grievance, he said he has already filed three grievances but it's "never ending".

111.title: SRK ropes in 'Fauda' creator to train son Aryan as a writer: Report
111.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has reportedly roped in Israeli actor-writer Lior Raz, the creator of the action-thriller series 'Fauda', to train Aryan Khan for his debut as a writer. According to the report, Aryan is working on a web series which will be backed by Red Chillies Entertainment. The project will reportedly go on floors by the end of 2022.

112.title: Arjun Kapoor is not a part of 'Pushpa 2', confirms producer
112.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' producer Naveen Yerneni has refuted reports that claimed actor Arjun Kapoor is in talks to play the role of a police officer in the film. "Fahadh Faasil is doing the role. So it's...[a] false news," Naveen said. He further said the film will go on the floors by the end of this month.

113.title: Tiafoe and Fritz set up all-American final at Japan Open
113.article_body: Fourth seed Frances Tiafoe defeated South Korea's Soonwoo Kwon 6-2, 0-6, 6-4 in semi-final on Saturday to set up an all-American final against Taylor Fritz at Japan Open Tennis Championships. "It was a weird match," said Tiafoe. Third seed Fritz beat Canada's Denis Shapovalov 6-3, 6-7(5-7), 6-3 to advance to his third ATP Tour final of the season.

114.title: Class 9 pass aspiring to be CM: Prashant Kishor on Tejashwi Yadav
114.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor said Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav is someone who has studied till Class nine but "is aspiring to become CM". "If your son has studied up to Class nine, he will not even get a job as a peon," Kishor said in a public address in Bihar. He said common people are at fate's mercy.

115.title: We will solve Assam flood issue if we get 5 more years: Amit Shah
115.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the government needs five years to fully solve the perennial flood problem in Assam. "We promised an Assam free from terrorism, corruption and flood. We've already achieved the first two. Give us five more years," said Shah. He added that "an ambitious project" is being prepared under the aegis of the North Eastern Council.

116.title: UK opens new licensing round for oil exploration in North Sea
116.article_body: The UK government has started a fresh licensing round for oil and gas exploration in the North Sea, even as environmentalists have criticised the move. The government contended fuel extraction from the North Sea will create jobs and boost the country's energy security. Climate Minister Graham Stuart said, "When we burn our own gas, it's got lower emissions...than foreign gas."

117.title: Forming CM Shinde's govt took months of planning: Maha minister
117.article_body: Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil said the formation of the BJP-Eknath Shinde's Sena government in the state took 'months of planning'. "To keep the morale high...we had to keep saying that 'BJP will soon return to power'...party required 40 MLAs, which was not easy," said Patil. He added that it was "easy" to dislodge the governments in Madhya Pradesh and Karnataka.

118.title: Perhaps saved Assamese society: Cong leader on Shah's 'beaten up' claim
118.article_body: Responding to Union Minister Amit Shah's claim that he was "beaten up" during his visit to Assam by erstwhile CM Hiteswar Saikia, Congress spokesperson Bobbeeta Sharma said Saikia "perhaps...saved Assamese society from dangers of polarization". Recalling his initial days in politics, earlier today, Shah said that he and his fellow ABVP members "were beaten up a lot by Hiteswar Saikia".

119.title: Rahul Gandhi's statement on Savarkar, RSS is full of lies: RSS leader
119.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar on Saturday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his statement against VD Savarkar and RSS, calling it "full of lies". "It has become a fashion of Congress to level false allegations against RSS and Savarkar," Kumar said. "This is a form of frustration of Rahul Gandhi's failure in politics," he said, adding Congress divided the country.

120.title: Youngsters will be assigned special roles in next polls: J&K Cong chief
120.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Congress chief Vikar Rasool Wani promised a special role for youngsters in the next Assembly elections. "Youngsters need to make strenuous efforts to strengthen the party at the grassroot level," Wani said. "The Congress will make the role of the youngsters more vibrant in order to nurture them for future challenges," Wani added.

121.title: 4 including 3 kids killed, 16 hurt as gas cylinders explode in Rajasthan
121.article_body: Four persons, including three children, died and over 16 others sustained injuries after multiple cooking gas cylinders exploded in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, police said on Saturday. The injured persons were taken to Mahatma Gandhi Hospital for treatment. District Collector Himanshu Gupta has ordered a probe into the matter and assured that anyone found responsible would be prosecuted as per law.

122.title: 510 human trafficking cases reported in Germany in 2021: Police
122.article_body: German Police and customs officials responded to 510 human trafficking cases in the country in 2021, which was an increase of 10% from the figure of 2020, the Federal Criminal Police Office said. The average age of the victims was 15 years, it added. The number of children affected due to trafficking was 23% higher in 2021 than in 2020.

123.title: Man tweets pics of glass shards in pizza & tags Mumbai Police, police responds
123.article_body: A man shared pictures of some glass shards that he allegedly found in pizza ordered online from Domino's. "This speaks volumes about global brand food that we're getting," he tweeted while tagging Mumbai Police and FSSAI. "Please write to customer care...If they don't reply or give an unsatisfactory reply, then you can think of a legal remedy," said Police.

124.title: Probe agencies acting on whims: Nitish on chargesheet against Lalu
124.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacted to the CBI chargesheet against RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav in the land-for-job scam, saying central government probe agencies are "acting upon whims and fancies". "You...may recall what happened...five years ago which caused me to walk out of the alliance...Now that I'm back in alliance (with RJD), a new thing has started," said Kumar.

125.title: BJP will form govt for the 7th time in Gujarat: Ex-CM Vijay Rupani
125.article_body: Gujarat's former CM Vijay Rupani on Saturday said that Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders are assured that the party will win the upcoming state elections and form government in Gujarat for the seventh time. "Our party will touch more than two-thirds of the majority," he added. He claimed people of Gujarat have no faith in Congress or Aam Aadmi Party.

126.title: Muslim minorities have contributed most to Bollywood: Sharad Pawar
126.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday said that Muslim minorities have made the biggest contribution to Bollywood. "In all the fields, whether it is art...writing, or...poetry, the highest contribution has come from the Minorities, and...in the Urdu language," Pawar said. "Muslim minorities...have contributed the most [to Bollywood], and we cannot ignore their contribution," he added.

127.title: Drunk woman misbehaves with guard, grabs his collar in Noida society; video viral
127.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, a woman in an inebriated state can be seen misbehaving with a security guard of a building in Uttar Pradesh's Noida after an altercation over some matter. She grabs him by the collar and then throws his cap in the air. The incident reportedly took place at Ajnara Homes society.

128.title: Scripts I'm getting now are better than what I was getting a decade ago: Kareena
128.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan said in an interview that it's the "age of actors" today. She added that the scripts she's being offered are "way better" than what she was offered a decade ago. "It's an exciting time not just for female actors but every actor across the board," said Kareena, who was recently seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

129.title: Plea seeks injunction over 'inaccurate portrayal of Hindu gods' in 'Adipurush'
129.article_body: A plea has been filed in a Delhi court seeking an injunction against the movie 'Adipurush', alleging it has depicted Hindu gods in an "unwarranted" and "inaccurate" way in its teaser. The matter has been listed for hearing on Monday. "The defendants have hurt the religious, cultural, historical and civilizational sentiments of the plaintiff and other Hindus," the plea stated.

130.title: Proud of the way girls came back after loss to Pakistan: Smriti
130.article_body: After India's 59-run win over defending champions Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup 2022, India stand-in captain Smriti Mandhana said it was a total team performance. "It was disappointing in the last match. It is good to come back after that loss, really proud of the girls," she added. India lost their last match against Pakistan by 13 runs.

131.title: 1000s of families benefited: Atlee thanks SRK for shooting Jawan in Chennai
131.article_body: Atlee, director of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan', on Saturday thanked the actor for agreeing to shoot the film in Chennai. He tweeted, "Special thanks to you for having...shoot happen in Chennai, 1000s of family were benefited...'KING IS A KING ALWAYS' a big bow and respect to you sir." Shah Rukh reportedly shot for nearly 30 days in Chennai.

132.title: Cricketers like Hardik Pandya come once in many years: Pollard
132.article_body: West Indies cricketer Kieron Pollard said that players like India's Hardik Pandya come "once in many years". "Let's just enjoy him (Pandya). We tend to put them up on [a] pedestal, and the moment they don't deliver, we drag them down," Pollard said. He added, "I know him for a couple of years and I understand how he thinks."

133.title: 45-yr-old woman killed, 3 others injured in house collapse in Raj
133.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was killed and three others of a family were injured after a wall of their tin-shed house collapsed on Friday in Rajasthan's Baran, police said. Police said 50-year-old Kanshiram Sahariya, his wife Sugna, son Golu and daughter Lila Kumari were asleep when the incident occurred. The woman succumbed to her injuries on the way to the hospital.

134.title: PM Modi to address public rally in Himachal's Chamba on Oct 13
134.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will address a public rally at Himachal Pradesh's Chamba on October 13, marking his second visit to the poll-bound state in less than 10 days. PM Modi will launch 80MW Bajoli hydroelectric project and lay foundation stone of Chanju-III and Deothal Chanju hydel projects, CM Jairam Thakur said. He will also launch Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana-III.

135.title: India beat defending champions Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup
135.article_body: India defeated defending champions Bangladesh by 59 runs in Women's Asia Cup on Saturday. Opener Shafali Verma, adjudged 'Player of the Match', scored 55 runs off 44 balls and returned bowling figures of 4-0-10-2, while all-rounder Deepti Sharma picked up two wickets. Opting to bat, India scored 159/5 in 20 overs. Bangladesh managed 100/7 in 20 overs.

136.title: Sena Bhawan employee arrested for spying for Pakistan
136.article_body: A 31-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistani intelligence agencies, Rajasthan Police said on Saturday. Ravi Prakash Meena, a resident of Rajasthan, was posted as a class-4 employee at the Sena Bhawan in Delhi, police informed. Meena was honey-trapped by a female Pakistani agent with whom he was sharing confidential and strategic information about the Indian Army.

137.title: Remote-control allegations insulting to Cong Prez candidates: Rahul
137.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that whoever is elected as the party's new President next month, "will not be remote-controlled" by the Gandhi family and will have a free hand in taking decisions. Senior leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor are fighting for the top post. "Frankly, this tone is insulting to both of them," Gandhi added.

138.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Oct 12, list released
138.article_body: Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on October 9, while it's likely over Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh on October 12, as per the IMD. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is likely over West Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya till October 12. Further, it is likely over Madhya Pradesh, Nagaland and Manipur till October 11.

139.title: Rape on pretext of marriage claim not valid if woman has sex knowing man is married: HC
139.article_body: The allegation of rape on the false promise of marriage does not stand if a woman continues to have sexual relations with a man despite knowledge about his married status, the Kerala High Court has said. It said this while quashing a rape case against a 33-year-old man. The relationship between him and the complainant seemed consensual, the HC said.

140.title: Mentally-ill man beaten on suspicion of being child lifter in Chhattisgarh
140.article_body: A mentally-challenged man roaming around Chhattisgarh's Khopli village was allegedly beaten up by a mob on Friday on suspicion of being a child lifter, police said. The victim, who did not suffer injuries in the incident, was rescued by police officers and shifted to a Bilaspur-based government hospital for mentally-challenged people. Police arrested three people aged between 20 and 37.

141.title: I'm back to 100%: England captain Buttler ahead of T20I series vs Australia
141.article_body: Ahead of England-Australia three-match T20I series, England captain Jos Buttler, who sustained a calf injury during The Hundred in August, said, "I'm back to 100 percent." He added, "Had a good time in Pakistan rehabbing, probably could have played earlier, but with...World Cup around the corner, it was the right thing to do." Buttler missed the T20I series against Pakistan.

142.title: 4 masked men rob retired magistrate of laptop, ₹10,500 cash in Raj
142.article_body: Four masked men robbed the house of a retired magistrate named Aditya Narayan Sharma in Rajasthan, police said on Saturday. The armed criminals stole a laptop, a mobile phone, some artificial jewellery and ₹10,500 in cash from his house in Jaipur's Mansarovar area. Police said they are trying to identify the criminals through footage from cameras installed in the area.

143.title: Ranbir Kapoor stops accepting film offers, decides to take paternity leave: Report
143.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has decided to take paternity leave once his baby is born, said reports. Ranbir, who is completing his work on Sandeep Vanga's 'Animal', hasn't accepted any other project as of now, and will do so only after his paternity leave, reports added. Actress Alia Bhatt will reportedly return to work as soon as she can after delivery.

144.title: 'Anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back' banners emerge in Guj ahead of AAP rally
144.article_body: Banners showing Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wearing a white skull cap surfaced in Gujarat ahead of the AAP leader's rally in the state on Saturday. Some banners bearing his pictures carried lines like "I consider Hindu religion as madness", while others bore "anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back" message. This comes after Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam attended a religious conversion event.

145.title: Kejriwal promises free Ayodhya Ram Temple visit for Guj residents
145.article_body: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while addressing a gathering in poll-bound Gujarat, promised "free visit to Ayodhya's Ram Temple to people of Gujarat", if the AAP forms the government in the state. This comes after banners and posters calling Kejriwal "anti-Hindu" and showing him purportedly wearing a skull cap surfaced in several cities in the state.

146.title: UP man ends life by hanging from tree after being scolded by parents
146.article_body: A man allegedly ended his life by hanging himself from a tree near Risaura village in Banda, UP on Saturday. The deceased, Deepu Nishad (22), was hurt after being scolded by his parents and this seems to be one of the main reasons behind his death, police said. Notably, police have started with their investigation.

147.title: There's no fight between us: Ali Asgar on equation with Kapil Sharma
147.article_body: Actor-comedian Ali Asgar, speaking about his equation with Kapil Sharma, said, "There were times when I missed his call and on other times, he missed my calls." "There is no fight or anger between us," he added. "I am not rigid about not being part of The Kapil Sharma Show again," said Ali, who quit the show in 2017.

148.title: MCD Special Officer appointed as Principal Secy in Delhi Home Dept
148.article_body: Special Officer of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) Ashwani Kumar has been appointed as Principal Secretary (Home) of the Delhi government, an order issued by Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena stated. The 1992 batch IAS officer will continue to hold the charge of Special Officer of MCD. Kumar was appointed as Special Officer by the Home Ministry in May 2022.

149.title: Man stabs mother-in-law to death over property dispute in Telangana
149.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was reportedly stabbed to death by her son-in-law over a property dispute in Telangana's Karimnagar. The accused, along with two of his family members, also attacked the victim's mother, who was sleeping with her. According to police, the victim, a widow, owned five-acre land, and the accused had been asking for a share in her property.

150.title: BJP the only ideology-based party in the country: Nadda in Guwahati
150.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said the Congress does not have any particular ideology and BJP is the only ideology-based national party in India. Speaking at the inauguration of Atal Bihari Vajpayee Bhawan in Guwahati, he said, the BJP proposed to set up 512 offices across the country, out of which 236 offices have been constructed and 154 are under construction.

151.title: EOW inspector, ex-Mumbai Police officers booked for filing fake case
151.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered a case against seven persons, including two of its retired officers and an Economic Offences Wing (EOW) inspector, for allegedly getting an MHADA official jailed in a false case. The complainant alleged that police fabricated evidence and witnesses against him. The official was accused of cheating people on the pretext of providing flats at cheap rates.

152.title: Liquor sale banned in east B'luru tomorrow on account of Eid-e-Milad
152.article_body: On account of Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi on Sunday, police have banned the sale of liquor in parts of east Bengaluru. Clubs and five-star hotels in the area have, however, been exempted from the ban. "On the occasion of Eid-e-Milad, there will be processions...to maintain peace and security the sale of liquor is prohibited," an order issued by the city Police Commissioner stated.

153.title: Delhi civic ward delimitation report to be sent to Centre next week: Officials
153.article_body: The panel, which is tasked with the delimitation exercise of civic wards in Delhi, is expected to present its report next week to the Union Home Ministry, officials said. The panel's draft report has reduced the number of wards in Delhi from 272 to 250. It also suggested that the number of municipalities in the 23 Assembly constituencies be reduced.

154.title: Few Mumbai Central Railway suburban lines to be blocked tomorrow
154.article_body: The Central Railway in Mumbai said services on some of its suburban rail lines will be blocked due to maintenance work on Sunday. Thane-Kalyan Up and Down fast lines and Kurla-Vashi Up and Down Harbour lines will be blocked till around 4 pm. Meanwhile, some Down fast services leaving CSMT and Up fast/semi-fast train services leaving Kalyan will be diverted.

155.title: Proposal to create 79 posts in Thane's disaster response team approved
155.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday approved the proposal to create 79 posts in the Disaster Response Team of Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) due to increasing urbanisation and natural calamities. "Now there will be 79 more posts, including the post of commandant of Class II, three deputy commandant of Class III and 75...responders," Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell chief said.

156.title: Rail traffic in northern Germany disrupted by alleged sabotage
156.article_body: Rail traffic in northern Germany came to a three-hour halt on Saturday due to a suspected act of sabotage, state-owned rail operator Deutsche Bahn (DB) said. An investigation into the incident has been launched, DB added. Notably, the EU and NATO last month stressed the need to protect critical infrastructure after leaks were detected on the Nord Stream gas pipelines.

157.title: Shehnaaz Gill's father gets death threats, told on call 'Will kill you before Diwali'
157.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill's father Santokh Singh recently received death threats from an unknown person via phone call. The caller reportedly abused Santokh on the call and told that he'd kill him at his home before Diwali. Santokh has filed a police complaint. He got the call while he was going from Punjab's Beas to Tarn Taran.

158.title: World's largest portrait of Queen Elizabeth created over UK skies by pilot, pic viral
158.article_body: A pilot named Amal Larhlid created the world's largest portrait of Queen Elizabeth on October 6. She did it through a flight path that covered 413 km, creating a portrait 105 km tall and 63 km wide northwest of London. Flightradar24 shared the tribute on Twitter, adding that Larhlid also intended to raise money for Hospice UK.

159.title: Ox kills 1, injures 8 at Durga idol immersion carnival in Bengal
159.article_body: A man was killed and eight others were injured after an ox went on a rampage at a Durga idol immersion carnival in West Bengal's Raiganj on Friday night. The incident took place when the Durga Puja committee arranged for ox-drawn carriages to showcase the idols during the procession. The deceased's daughter has demanded ex-gratia compensation from the state government.

160.title: Man-eating tiger which killed 10 people shot dead in Bihar
160.article_body: A three-year-old tiger, which had killed at least 10 people in and around Valmiki Tiger Reserve (VTR) in Bihar's West Champaran since September, was on Saturday shot dead by forest officials, as per reports. This comes after the Bihar government on Friday directed the state Environment, Forest and Climate Change Department to shoot the man-eating tiger.

161.title: Militants kidnap Pak minister after blocking road, release him after negotiations
161.article_body: Militants on Friday kidnapped senior Pakistan minister Abaidullah Baig after blocking a road connecting the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Gilgit-Baltistan regions. Baig was released on Saturday morning after negotiations with the militants who are reportedly seeking the release of some of their accomplices. The abduction was perpetrated by the most-wanted militant commander Habibur Rahman, reports said.

162.title: Pune civic body bans illegal firecracker stalls on footpaths, roads
162.article_body: Ahead of Diwali, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is enforcing a total ban on the sale of firecrackers by illegal stalls on footpaths, roads and congested areas. Deputy Municipal Commissioner Madhav Jagtap said the move is in line with the Supreme Court's directions. In 2018, the state government asked PMC to take steps in accordance with the Supreme Court's directions.

163.title: Vice-Admiral Sarin takes charge as Commandant of AFMC in Pune
163.article_body: Surgeon Vice-Admiral Arti Sarin has assumed charge as the new Director and Commandant of the Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC) in Pune. Vice-Admiral Sarin, a graduate of the AFMC herself, was conferred with the Vishisht Seva Medal in 2021. She has served as the Head of the Department of Radiation Oncology Army Hospital R&R Delhi and Command Hospital/AFMC Pune.

164.title: 2 Palestinian teenagers fatally shot by Israeli forces
164.article_body: Two Palestinian teenagers were shot dead by the Israeli army in two separate incidents of clashes in the West Bank on Friday, Palestinian officials said. In one of the incidents, the Israeli army said its troops opened fire in response to a suspect hurling firebombs. Meanwhile, near Ramallah, soldiers responded with gunfire after encountering rock-throwing protesters, the army added.

165.title: Which Alauddin Khilji applies Tilak: Manoj on criticism over Saif's Raavan look
165.article_body: 'Adipurush' dialogue writer Manoj Muntashir reacted to controversy over Saif Ali Khan's look as Raavan in the film. Following the release of its teaser, many on social media compared his look to Ranveer Singh's Khilji in 'Padmaavat'. Manoj said, "Which Alauddin Khilji wears Rudraksha...and applies Tilak on...forehead." He added the film is being judged on the basis of one-minute-long teaser.

166.title: Would like to be in films that offer me more scope & time: Radhika Apte
166.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte said she would definitely like to be in films that offer her more scope and time. Talking about 'Vikram Vedha', Radhika said, "I knew the story was about two men. My part was always going to be small." "That said, it's not about screen time...It's a good film, and that matters to me," she added.

167.title: I've been a big fan of him: Vivian Richards on India captain Rohit
167.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma, ex-West Indies captain Vivian Richards said, "I have been a big fan of Rohit even before he became the captain." He added, "I have always liked Rohit and especially when Virat Kohli was the captain." Rohit, who made his India debut in June 2007, became India's captain across all three formats in February this year.

168.title: Bharat Rashtra Samithi's main focus is 2024 Lok Sabha polls: KTR
168.article_body: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) leader and Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said his party's main focus now is the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) was named BRS, after the party decided to go national. Rao said his party would like to focus on Maharashtra and Karnataka as the good work done in Telangana is best known there.

169.title: Five Hong Kong teenagers sentenced for urging 'armed revolution'
169.article_body: A court on Saturday sentenced five teenagers with a Hong Kong group to up to three years in detention at a correctional facility for urging an "armed revolution" against the Chinese state. They had pleaded guilty to "inciting others to subvert state power" in a national security case. "There's no evidence to...prove anyone was incited...but this...risk exists," the court said.

170.title: Really glad that Ajay Devgn is doing 'Kaithi' remake: Karthi on 'Bholaa'
170.article_body: Actor Karthi has said he's looking forward to the Hindi version of his Tamil film 'Kaithi'. Titled 'Bholaa', the remake will feature Ajay Devgn and Tabu, among others. "A lot of people called me and they wanted to buy...rights to Kaithi, but then Ajay sir was the first one to get it. I'm really glad...he's doing the remake," Karthi said.

171.title: Ranveer Singh teaches 'Tattad Tattad' steps to NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo, video viral
171.article_body: A video of actor Ranveer Singh teaching 'Tattad Tattad' steps to NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo has gone viral. Sharing the video on Instagram, Ranveer wrote, "The Greek Freak gettin' his Tattad Tattad on!" A fan commented, "The crossover we didn't know we needed." "Haha legend," cricketer Shreyas Iyer commented on the video.

172.title: Which Hrithik Roshan films have clocked ₹100 crore globally?
172.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' has become Hrithik Roshan's 13th movie to cross the ₹100-crore mark globally. The first film of Hrithik to gross ₹100 crore was 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' and it was followed by 'Krrish', 'Dhoom 2', 'Jodhaa Akbar', 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara', 'Agneepath', 'Krrish 3', 'Bang Bang', 'Mohenjo Daro', 'Kaabil', 'Super 30' and 'War'.

173.title: Hrithik's rumoured girlfriend Saba calls out woman mocking her look, shares screenshot
173.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan's rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad took to her Instagram Stories to call out a troll for mocking her look. "You were looking like chheeee (yuck), eeew, yaak, whatever you understand...Take it," the woman had commented. Saba wrote, "This is Shruti...She...just follows me to share her abundant hate...There are many like her out there...Don't be like Shruti."

174.title: Policeman shoots repeatedly at teen eating burger inside car in US, video surfaces
174.article_body: A policeman in US' Texas was fired after he shot and wounded a 17-year-old who was sitting in his car and eating a hamburger.
