Notably, the bodies were recovered from the pond and sent for post-mortem, Choudhary added.

350.title: CM announces ₹10 lakh compensation after J'khand woman burnt alive
350.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Friday condoled the demise of a 22-year-old woman who was burnt alive by a man in Dumka for allegedly rejecting his marriage proposal. The CM announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh for her family. The accused allegedly set the woman ablaze after pouring petrol on her when she was asleep. He's currently in police custody.

351.title: 2 youths set off fireworks & obstruct traffic on NH-9 in Ghaziabad, arrested
351.article_body: Two youths were arrested on Friday after they allegedly obstructed traffic by sitting on the roof of a car and setting off fireworks in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The incident reportedly took place on the NH-9 in the Vijay Nagar police station limits on Thursday. One of the vehicles seen in a video of the incident has been seized, police said.

352.title: Sajid Khan has right to live, don't do drama of quitting B'wood: Payal to Mandana
352.article_body: After Mandana Karimi said she doesn't want to work in Bollywood while talking about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan bagging 'Bigg Boss 16', Payal Rohatgi reacted. "Sajid...has...right to live [and] earn money...You oppose him but don't do...drama of quitting Bollywood," she wrote on Instagram Stories. Mandana earlier alleged that Sajid once asked her to remove clothes during a meeting.

353.title: Told wife 'If Zwigato doesn't work, I will not lose anything': Kapil Sharma
353.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma, speaking about his upcoming film 'Zwigato', said, "I told my wife, if [it] doesn't work, I'll not lose anything. But if it succeeds...then I'll get a lot from it." "Comedy shows are my bread and butter. Because of that...I was motivated to look for something else...I thought the kitchen is safe, let's experiment a bit," Kapil added.

354.title: British minister sacked over allegations of 'serious misconduct'
354.article_body: British Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday fired Conor Burns, a minister with the trade department, following a "complaint of serious misconduct", Truss's office said on Friday. "The Prime Minister took direct action on being informed of this allegation," Truss's office added. The nature of the allegation against Burns was not immediately known.

355.title: Rare pink diamond sold for world record ₹477 crore at auction in Hong Kong, pics released
355.article_body: A rare pink diamond was sold for HK$453,223,000 (around ₹477 crore) in Hong Kong on Friday, setting a world record for the highest price per carat for a diamond sold at an auction. The 11.15-carat Williamson Pink Star diamond was auctioned by Sotheby’s Hong Kong. The bidding war for the pink diamond lasted 20 minutes.

356.title: New species of beetle named after Novak Djokovic
356.article_body: Serbian scientists named a new species of beetle after ex-world number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic. The insect, which belongs to Duvalius genus of ground beetles present in Europe and was discovered several years ago in underground pit in Serbia, has been named 'Duvalius Dokovici'. "We feel urged to pay Djokovic back in...way we can," a researcher said.

357.title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin files nomination for DMK President post
357.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday filed his nomination papers seeking to contest the election for the post of Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) President. Stalin visited DMK headquarters, Anna Arivalayam, to submit the nomination papers in the presence of senior leaders. The election is likely to be held on Sunday. Notably, Stalin is the current President of DMK.

358.title: CBI files chargesheet against Lalu, 15 others in railway jobs scam
358.article_body: The CBI filed its chargesheet against RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in the alleged land-for-job scam in Indian Railways on Friday. Lalu's wife Rabri Devi and 14 others have also been named as accused. The case pertains to allegations that prime properties in Patna were allegedly sold or gifted to Lalu's family members in return for railway jobs.

359.title: US, UK hold drone drill in Persian Gulf amid tensions with Iran
359.article_body: The US and the UK held a joint drone drill in the Persian Gulf on Friday. The drill included two American and two British warships and three Saildrone Explorers. The drill was held as tensions between the US and Iran have spiked in the seas recently and amidst stalled negotiations of the Iran nuclear deal.

360.title: Kidnapper, killer of Indian-origin family in US sent them angry texts: Relatives
360.article_body: The man who allegedly kidnapped and killed an Indian family of four in the US had sent them "angry texts or emails" about a year ago, relatives of the family told police. The man, identified as Jesus Salgado, worked for the family, who had a trucking business in California. He had a longstanding dispute with them, police added.

361.title: IAS officers should adopt out-of-box thinking in their work: PM Modi
361.article_body: During his address in the concluding session of the Assistant Secretary Programme 2022, PM Narendra Modi asked the IAS officers to adopt out-of-the-box thinking and a holistic approach in their work. According to an official statement, "PM Modi said that the officers have the opportunity to serve the country during the 'Amrit Kaal' and help realise the five pledges."

362.title: PM to declare Modhera as India's 1st solar-powered village on Oct 9
362.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will declare Gujarat's Modhera as India's first solar-powered village on October 9. The village will be the first in India to be a net renewable energy producer. Solar rooftops installed on more than 1,300 rural houses under the 'Solarisation of Modhera Sun Temple and Town’ project are expected to bring down electricity bills by 60-100%.

363.title: US sanctions Iranian officials for suppressing ‘peaceful protest’
363.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on seven Iranian officials, including two ministers, for allegedly suppressing "peaceful protest" in the country. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police over an "improper hijab". Tehran has attempted to end the protests, resulting in the reported death of dozens of agitators.

364.title: 'Real' Rahul Gandhi emerging out of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Cong's Jairam
364.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said the "real" Rahul Gandhi is emerging out of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which completed a month on Friday. "I wouldn't say it is the new Rahul Gandhi, but the real Rahul Gandhi that is being seen," he said. "I think what the yatra has done is to show to...Congress...that we can do it," he added.

365.title: PM not worried about World Bank's forecast, poverty report: Congress
365.article_body: Congress said PM Modi is "hardly worried" and "still indulging in empty slogans and false promises" as the World Bank trimmed India's growth forecast for FY 2022-2023. Forecasting growth at 6.5%, the World Bank said up to 5.6 crore Indians were pushed into poverty in 2020. "Farmers are committing suicide citing PM's inefficiency and apathy," said the Congress.

366.title: Amit Shah's public rallies will change political discourse in J&K: BJP
366.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's BJP chief Ravinder Raina said Union Home Minister Amit Shah's recent public rallies will change the political discourse in the Union Territory. "The enthusiasm of people in both the rallies was unmatched and historic," Raina said. "The Modi government has devoted itself to the welfare of every community in Jammu and Kashmir beyond...region and religion," he added.

367.title: Initially I thought someone from south would play my role: Gauri on Taali
367.article_body: Transgender activist Gauri Sawant has said initially, she thought some actor or actress from the south would play her role in the upcoming web series 'Taali'. "When I was told Sushmita Sen's name, I laughed. Her Chunri Chunri song kept coming to...mind. I...couldn't believe...she would be playing my role at first. But after signing contracts, I was convinced," Gauri added.

368.title: Stones pelted as 2 groups clash during Durga Visarjan in Chhattisgarh
368.article_body: Two groups going to perform Durga Visarjan got into an altercation with each other in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Friday. ASP Rajendra Jaiswal said the groups, which belonged to two different Durga Pandal committees, wanted to immerse the idol first. They started pelting stones and also used sticks and rods against each other. An idol of goddess Durga was reportedly vandalised.

369.title: Draconid meteor shower set to light up skies on October 9 &10
369.article_body: The Draconid meteor shower is all set to light up the skies between 9 to 10 October. According to NASA, these meteors are generally faint owing to their relatively slow movement as they enter Earth's atmosphere at just 40,000 mph. Hence, researchers believe, this time, the meteor might appear even fainter due to the full moon rising on October 9.

370.title: Proud that 'Ram Setu' is coming, film proves our rich history: Om Raut
370.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut, speaking about Akshay Kumar's upcoming movie 'Ram Setu', said, "Ramayana is our history, and as...proud devotee of Lord Rama I'm extremely happy since in Ram Setu it's been proved that all that happened wasn't fiction." "I even told Akshay sir that I'm very proud that this film is coming. It proves our rich history," Om added.

371.title: Pic of 'KGF' actor Yash with Lewis Hamilton goes viral
371.article_body: A picture of Kannada actor Yash with seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton has gone viral. In the photo, 'Charlie's Angels' actress Ella Balinska is also seen posing with the 'KGF' actor and Lewis at the tactical shooting facility Taran Tactical. Yash had earlier uploaded a video of him shooting at Taran Tactical and tagged Hollywood action director JJ Perry.

372.title: Gauri Lankesh's mother, sister march with Rahul amid 'Bharat Jodo'
372.article_body: The mother and sister of late journalist Gauri Lankesh, who was murdered in 2017, marched alongside Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the Karnataka leg of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Friday. "I stand for Gauri Lankesh and countless others like her, who represent the true spirit of India," tweeted Gandhi. He added that Gauri stood for 'truth, courage and freedom'.

373.title: Fighting Presidential polls to 'save Cong's ideology, principles': Kharge
373.article_body: Senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Friday said that he was fighting Congress' Presidential election to "save the party's ideology and principles". Launching his campaign from Gujarat, Kharge said, "This is an internal election...I met the delegates and leaders, who in large numbers have assured to support me." "I am not fighting this election on my own will," he added.

374.title: 2 army personnel killed, 1 injured as tank barrel bursts in UP
374.article_body: Two army personnel were killed and another injured after the barrel of a T-90 tank burst during a field firing exercise in Uttar Pradesh. "The commander and the gunner, unfortunately, succumbed to burn injuries. The driver is out of danger," said an army official. He added that a court of inquiry has been launched to probe the incident.

375.title: UP CM directs officials to speed up relief work in rain-hit districts
375.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed district magistrates of the regions affected by heavy rains to carry out relief work on priority. He instructed officials to make arrangements for drainage on priority in waterlogged areas, said an official statement issued on Friday. CM Adityanath also directed the officials to sanction compensation to relatives of the deceased, the statement said.

376.title: Harbhajan alleges illegal activities by Punjab Cricket Association, writes letter to CM
376.article_body: Punjab Cricket Association's Chief Advisor Harbhajan Singh wrote a letter to the association's stakeholders and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, alleging illegal activities by office-bearers. "PCA is trying hard to induct 150 members with voting rights to tilt...balance in their favour and it's being done without...assent of apex council...or without consulting Chief Advisor," the former cricketer wrote.

377.title: 2 women held, 246.95 gm heroin worth ₹50 lakh seized in Assam
377.article_body: Security forces arrested two women from Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Friday for allegedly carrying 246.95 grams of heroin worth ₹50 lakh, police said. Acting on a tip-off, the CRPF and railway police personnel seized the drugs from two women who were waiting at Bokajan railway station, police said. The drugs were reportedly hidden in 20 soap boxes.

378.title: Hong Kong to offer 5 lakh free airline tickets for tourists
378.article_body: Hong Kong recently said that it plans to give away 5 lakh airline tickets to global visitors in order to boost its COVID-19-hit tourism industry. This was confirmed by a spokesperson from the Airport Authority Hong Kong. "Back in 2020, Airport Authority Hong Kong purchased...[the]...tickets in advance from...home-based airlines as part of a relief package," said the spokesperson.

379.title: Sanju lacks experience of playing against a big team: Kamran Akmal
379.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said that India's Sanju Samson "lacks experience when it comes to playing against a big team". "Sanju took his time initially. It would have been a different story if he had attacked right from the start," Akmal said. He added, "There was a lack of intent in the first 30-35 balls that he (Samson) faced."

380.title: ED can't address unemployment and price rise: DK Shivakumar to BJP
380.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar said "political battles must be fought on the political battlefield" after he appeared before the ED in a money laundering case. "BJP must understand ED can't address unemployment and price rise," added Shivakumar. He said that the "misuse of agencies by BJP" will get a "befitting reply" from the people of Karnataka in May 2023.

381.title: Argentine minister resigns after indigenous women evicted from land
381.article_body: Argentina's Minister of Women, Genders and Diversity on Thursday tendered her resignation over the eviction of a group of indigenous Mapuche women from land in the Patagonia region. Elizabeth Gomez Alcorta had criticised the eviction and subsequent arrest of six Mapuche women, one of whom was pregnant. The government has defended the eviction, which was ordered by a court.

382.title: PM scared of offending Chinese Prez?: Owaisi on India abstaining on UN vote
382.article_body: AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi said PM Modi should explain why India 'helped' China by abstaining on a draft UNHRC resolution seeking a debate on the human rights situation in Xinjiang. "Is he so scared of offending Xi Jinping, whom he met 18 times?" tweeted Owaisi. The Indian government said the decision was "in line with its long-held position".

383.title: VFX in 'Adipurush' was difficult to digest: Sunil Lahri
383.article_body: Actor Sunil Lahri, who portrayed the role of Laxman in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', said it was difficult for him to "digest" the VFX in the teaser of 'Adipurush'. Adding there were no "cartoonish effects" in his serial, Sunil said, "Earlier it was all manual, now it's all presets and they stick to that. They don't want to make any effort."

384.title: Shinde quit Sena, can't claim 'bow & arrow' symbol: Thackeray camp to EC
384.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's camp on Friday told the Election Commission (EC) that the Eknath Shinde-led faction cannot claim the 'bow and arrow' symbol as he and other MLAs in his camp had "voluntarily quit the party". This comes after Shinde's faction submitted a memorandum, seeking it be allocated the symbol ahead of the Andheri East Assembly bypoll.

385.title: Negative people in industry didn't want 'Brahmastra' to work: Karan Johar
385.article_body: Speaking about facing negativity for his film 'Brahmastra' from his own fraternity, filmmaker Karan Johar said being a part of the same industry, people sometimes don't want the film to work. "Sometimes people within the industry, who call themselves members of...media also, celebrate ruination of a film," he said. "You can be critical but being negative isn't nice," Karan added.

386.title: SSC exams only in Hindi, English discriminatory: Former K'taka CM
386.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Friday said it is discriminatory to conduct the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) exams for central government departments only in English and Hindi. He accused the Centre of trying to suppress regional languages. He further demanded that the government must conduct SSC exams in Kannada too, so that "talented people" of Karnataka can get selected.

387.title: Akshay, John, Abhishek, Bobby & Riteish to star in 'Housefull 5': Report
387.article_body: Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, Abhishek Bachchan, Bobby Deol and Riteish Deshmukh are reportedly teaming up for the fifth instalment of the 'Housefull' franchise. The film is expected to go on floors in 2023, report said. Akshay and Riteish have appeared in all parts of the franchise. John, Abhishek and Bobby starred in 'Housefull 2', 'Housefull 3' and 'Housefull 4' respectively.

388.title: Be extra cautious while travelling to India due to crime, terrorism: US in advisory
388.article_body: The US has issued a new advisory warning its citizens to "exercise increased caution in India due to crime and terrorism". It also tells Americans to not travel to the Union Territory of J&K (except Ladakh and Leh), and within 10 km of the India-Pakistan border. It says, "Indian authorities report rape is one of the fastest-growing crimes in India".

389.title: B'wood must make 'Kaho Naa...' sequel with Anil & me: Actor's lookalike
389.article_body: American bodybuilder John Effer, who went viral for having a resemblance to actor Anil Kapoor, has said he wants to act in a Bollywood film. "I feel Bollywood must make a 'Kaho Naa...Pyaar Hai' part 2 with Anil Kapoor and [me]," he added. John further said all he wants is to have a life that's as 'jhakaas' as him.

390.title: Sanju pushed us at the end, but boys stood firm: Bavuma
390.article_body: After winning the first ODI in Lucknow, South African captain Temba Bavuma said that India's wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson pushed them "at the end" but the Proteas players "stood firm". "There wasn't much grass on the surface, we lost a couple of wickets in the middle overs, myself and Aiden (Markram), but the boys knuckled down," Bavuma said.

391.title: Pic shows Team India's 16 backroom staff members for T20 World Cup 2022
391.article_body: As many as 16 backroom staff members are accompanying Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The backroom staff is led by head coach Rahul Dravid. The backroom staff includes batting coach Vikram Rathour, bowling coach Paras Mhambrey and fielding coach T Dilip. It also includes media manager Moulin Parikh.

392.title: Will fence tracks by 2024: Railways after Vande Bharat Express hits buffaloes
392.article_body: A day after the new Vande Bharat Express train sustained damages after hitting buffaloes on Thursday, the Western Railway has said it aims to begin fencing work and complete it by 2024 to avoid such accidents in future. The local railway staff have been asked to counsel villagers regularly to not let their cattle wander near the tracks.

393.title: Juvenile tasked with 'eliminating' Salman Khan among 2 arrested by Delhi Police
393.article_body: Two terror accused have been arrested in connection to the May 9 RPG attack at Punjab Police headquarters in Mohali, Delhi Police said on Friday. One of them, a juvenile, was also tasked with "eliminating" actor Salman Khan, police said. The juvenile was instructed to target Salman by the Lawrence Bishnoi and Jaggu Bhagwanpuria syndicate, officials further said.

394.title: Verdict on carbon dating of 'Shivling' in Gyanvapi mosque deferred till Oct 11
394.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Friday deferred till October 11 the hearing on the Hindu side's plea seeking carbon dating of the structure they claimed to be a 'Shivling' found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee's arguments will be heard by the court on October 11, following which it'll pronounce its order on the matter.

395.title: ED attaches Amnesty-linked entity's assets worth ₹1.54 cr
395.article_body: The ED has provisionally attached assets worth ₹1.54 crore belonging to Indians for Amnesty International Trust (IAIT) under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), the agency informed on Friday. The money laundering case is based on an FIR registered by the CBI against Indian entities of Amnesty International for the alleged violation of the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA).

396.title: Free a dying man: Daughter of jailed Kashmiri separatist leader Altaf
396.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah's daughter has said her father is on ventilator in a critical condition and should be granted bail on humanitarian grounds. The 66-year-old, who was recently diagnosed with renal cancer, has been lodged in Tihar jail since 2017. "These are his final days...We appeal to the courts to free a dying man," his daughter said.

397.title: New supercontinent 'Amasia' will be created as Pacific ocean shrinks: Study
397.article_body: As per researchers, a new supercontinent will be created as the Pacific ocean is slowly closing up. It's shrinking by around one inch a year, due to which the tectonic plates on which the Americas rest are getting pushed westwards, they said. After 200-300 million years, the landmasses of Americas and Asia might collide to create a new supercontinent, Amasia.

398.title: If you give a sh*t, ask yourself why you're watching: Sajid's accuser as he joins Bigg Boss
398.article_body: A woman who accused Sajid Khan of inappropriate behaviour during #MeToo movement has spoken out after he was announced as a contestant on 'Bigg Boss 16'. "If you really give a sh*t, ask yourself why you're watching," she wrote on Instagram. "If you are someone that...genuinely wants to support the women who spoke up – WORK WITH THEM," she added.

399.title: I have lost 7-8 kg since last IPL, Chinese food is totally out of my menu: Prithvi Shaw
399.article_body: Cricketer Prithvi Shaw, who hasn't played for India since July 2021, said he has worked on his weight loss. He revealed he has lost 7-8 kg since the last IPL. "I spent a lot of time in...gym, did a lot of running, didn’t consume any sweets and cold drinks. Chinese food is totally out of my menu now," Shaw said.

400.title: Alarming: MEA as 6 Indian prisoners die in Pak in last 9 months
400.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Friday said six Indian prisoners, including five fishermen, have died in Pakistani custody in the last nine months. "They completed their sentences, but were illegally detained by Pakistan...These incidents are alarming," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. "Pakistan is duty-bound to maintain the safety and security of Indian prisoners," Bagchi added.
